MINERALS.Definition: natural substances like rocks or metals found in the ground

ASTEROID.Definition: a small rocky object that moves around the sun

ASTRONOMER.Definition: a scientist who studied space stars and planets

COUNTRYMAN.Definition: someone from the same country as him

OBSERVATORY.Definition: a building with equipment to study stars planets and space

ASTEROIDS.Definition: small rocky objects that move around the sun

ASTRONOMERS.Definition: scientists who study space stars and planets

IMMEASURABLY.Definition: to a very great degree, too much to measure

ORBIT.Definition: go around (a planet, star or moon)

GRAVITATIONAL.Definition: related to gravity, the force that pulls objects towards each other

GRAVITY.Definition: the force that pulls objects towards earth or another body in space

COLLISION.Definition: a crash or when two things hit each other

TRAJECTORY.Definition: the path it takes as it moves through space

CONSISTENCY.Definition: the quality of behaving the same way or not changing

SUNK.Definition: dropped below the surface or to the bottom

POLLUTING.Definition: making the environment dirty or harmful

PRACTICALITY.Definition: how useful or realistic it is

COMMITTING.Definition: deciding to do it and sticking to it

VERY WELL.Definition: used to express agreement or consent

ASSUME.Definition: suppose or take it as given

LIFT-OFF.Definition: the moment a spacecraft leaves the ground

CANOPY.Definition: a covering like a roof or top layer

DUST.Definition: tiny pieces of dirt or powder

LASERS.Definition: powerful beams of light used for cutting or other purposes

GRIND.Definition: crush into small pieces or powder

THRUSTERS.Definition: engines used to control its movement

TETHERS.Definition: ropes or cables used to tie or hold

ASTRONAUTS.Definition: people trained to travel and work in space

SACKS.Definition: large bags for carrying or storing things

APPROPRIATION.Definition: taking it for one's own use

GREY AREA.Definition: something not clearly defined or understood

EXPLOITATION.Definition: making use of and benefiting from

SHIELD.Definition: something used to protect or block

PROPELLANTS.Definition: substances used to push something forward like in rockets

FLOOD.Definition: arrive in overwhelming amounts or quantities and fill it

DEBRIS.Definition: broken pieces of rubbish or remains

CLEAR-CUT.Definition: very obvious or easy to understand

EMISSIONS.Definition: gases or substances released into the air

PATIENT.Definition: able to wait without getting upset

LACK.Definition: not having enough of it, shortage

PERSPECTIVE.Definition: a way of looking at or thinking about it
